result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin J Behm

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF639, 22CF263, 21CF629, 21CF640 called at 9:48am 
Defendant Benjamin J Behm in court, in custody.  Attorney John A. Chavez in court for Benjamin J Behm.  
Defendant Tyler J.R. Morrison in court, in custody. Attorney Walter Piel in court for Tyler Morrison. 
Attorney Monica J. Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 

Atty Chavez indicates that Mr. Behm intends to enter a plea, but requests the Court address motions prior to entry of any plea. 
Atty Piel indicates that he is ready to proceed to trial on Monday.

On Atty Piel's Motion to Suppress: 
--DA Hall agrees a Miranda/Goodchild hearing needs to be heard prior to trial. 

The Court will conduct Miranda/Goodchild hearing on 11/8/22 

recess: 9:58am 
NEXT: (1)Motion Hearing on 11/8/22 at 9:00am (2)JA to liaison with parties to schedule status conference, Atty Piel may appear via zoom if needed.

[MK] case called at 11:05am 
Defendant Benjamin J Behm in court, in custody, with Attorney John Chavez . ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
This hearing is scheduled on the State's request for reconsideration of the State's Joinder Motion.
Arguments are given by counsel.   
The Court continues its order that the cases are tried separately.  
Attorney Chavez indicates that he intends to file motions [clerk's inserted note:  this is related to Mr. Behm's case #21CF639]. 
The Court issues a Scheduling Order [as to Case #21CF639]:  
--both parties are to file any Motions by end of business on October 14th. 
--the other party's Response Brief is to be filed by end of business on October 28th.  
recess 11:25am 

NEXT:  the November 1st, 9:30am Status Conference remains on the Court's calendar

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Motion hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 10:50am 
Defendant Benjamin J Behm in court, in custody.  Attorney John A. Chavez in court for Benjamin J Behm.  Attorney Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Arraignment occurs:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Defense stands mute, pleas of "not guilty" entered by the Court 
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of (new) Joinder Motion
recess:  10:57am 

NEXT:   (1)Motion Hearing on 10/10/22 at 10:30am (Reconsideration of State's Joinder Motion) (2)Status Conference on 11/1/22 at 9:30am (convert to FSSC if joinder motion granted)
State's Supplemental Memorandum in Support of the Motion for Joinder

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #21CF639, #21CF640, #21CF640, #22CF263 called at 10:48am 
Co-Defendant Benjamin J Behm in court, in custody with Attorney John A. Chavez.   
Co-Defendant Tyler J.R. Morrison in court, in custody with Attorney Walter Piel
ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
After discussion with counsel, the Court denies the State's Motion for Joinder of Mr. Behm's case #21CF263 with the Co-Defendants cases #21CF639/21CF640.
Defense counsel both voice that that the currently scheduled trial dates should remain in place. However the Court then learns that one of the State's essential witnesses is not available on the currently scheduled October trial dates. The Court reschedules the trial dates 
The Court reschedules the Jury 
recess: 10:59am 

NEXT:  (1) JA-schedule Arraignment in #22CF263, (2) Status Conference in #21CF629 and in #22CF263, and Final Status Conference in cases #21CF639 & #21CF640--all on November 1st at 9:30am, (3) Jury Trial in cases #21CF639 & #21CF640 on November 7th, 8th, 9th at 8:30am

[MK] case called at 10:30am 
Defendant Benjamin J Behm in court, in custody, with Attorney John Chavez. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of WIsconsin. 
Det. B. Millers- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Parson
--cross examination by Attorney Chavez 
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Behm committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
Attorney Chavez requests that Arraignment be scheduled on a later date. 
recess 10:47am.  [see next event on this same date re scheduling]

Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF639, 22CF263, 21CF629, 21CF640 called at 2:56 PM 
Co-Defendant Benjamin J Behm in court, in custody with Attorney John A. Chavez.   
Co-Defendant Tyler J.R. Morrison in court, in custody with Attorney Walter Piel
DA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Initial Apperance occurs in Case 22CF263(Behm):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1000 CASH Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescription medications only as prescribed 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

Atty Chavez requests an additional status be scheduled in Mr. Behm's cases. 
Atty Piel indicates that Mr. Morrison's cases are not resolved. 

Scheduling is discussed. 
recess: 3:13pm 

NEXT:   As to Case 22CF263(Behm), (1)Preliminary Hearing on 7/29/22 at 10:30am (2)Status on 10/3/22 at 9:30am 
As to Case 21CF639(Behm), (1)Status on 7/29/22 at 10:30am (2)FSSC on 10/3/22 at 9:30am (3)Jury Trial on 10/10/22--10/12/22 at 8:30am 
As to Case 21CF629(Morrison), (1)Status on 7/29/22 at 10:30am (2)Status on 10/3/22 at 9:30am 
As to Case 21cf640(Morrison), (1)Status on 7/29/22 at 10:30am (2)FSSC on 10/3/22 at 9:30am (3)Jury Trial on 10/10/22--10/12/22 at 8:30am

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescription medications only as prescribed
